fullProgramDescription: The Department of Architecture offers an undergraduate program in Art and Design leading to a Bachelor of Science degree. The program is designed to provide students with a rigorous foundation in the principles of art and design, as well as the technical skills and knowledge necessary to pursue a career in the field. Students in the program take a range of courses in art and design, including studio classes, art history, and theory, as well as courses in other departments across MIT.
shortProgramDescription: MIT's Art and Design B.S. provides a comprehensive education in the arts, combining studio practice, art history, and theory to prepare students for diverse careers.
classHighlights: Studio courses: Students complete a sequence of studio courses that introduce fundamental principles and techniques in art and design, including drawing, painting, sculpture, and other mediums.
Art and Design Theory: Courses in art and design theory provide students with a critical understanding of the historical and contemporary contexts of art and design.
Art History: Students take courses in art history to gain a deeper understanding of the development of art and design across cultures and historical periods.
Electives and Concentrations: Students have the opportunity to explore specific areas of interest through elective courses and concentrations, such as graphic design, animation, or interactive media.
Interdisciplinary Opportunities: The program encourages students to explore intersections between art and design and other fields at MIT, such as science, technology, and engineering.
learningOutcomes: Demonstrate proficiency in a range of artistic and design techniques and mediums.
Understand the historical and contemporary contexts of art and design.
Apply critical thinking and analysis to artistic and design work.
Communicate effectively through visual and written means.
Pursue interdisciplinary approaches to art and design.
Develop a personal artistic or design voice and vision.
creditRequirements: 180-192 units (total), with at least 72 units in HASS and CI-H/CI-HW
additionalInformation: Students must declare the major by the end of the third semester and complete a set of required courses in art and design, including studio classes and art history.
